    Camping

    Essential gear and tips for comfortable, safe, and enjoyable camping trips.

    ‚õ∫ Shelter & Sleeping

    • Tents ‚Äì Choose size and season rating to match your trip.
    • Sleeping bags ‚Äì Pick warmth level based on climate.
    • Sleeping mats ‚Äì Add insulation and comfort.
    • Camping pillows ‚Äì Small but game-changing for a good night‚Äôs sleep.

    üî• Cooking & Eating

    • Portable stoves ‚Äì Gas, liquid fuel, or multi-fuel depending on conditions.
    • Cookware sets ‚Äì Lightweight pots, pans, and utensils.
    • Cool boxes ‚Äì Keep food fresh on longer trips.
    • Reusable tableware ‚Äì Plates, cups, and cutlery that last.

    üß≠ Essentials & Safety

    • Head torch or lantern ‚Äì Reliable light source for evenings.
    • First aid kit ‚Äì Compact but comprehensive.
    • Multi-tool or knife ‚Äì Handy for repairs and food prep.
    • Fire safety gear ‚Äì Bucket of water or sand near campfires.

    üéí Comfort & Extras

    • Camping chairs ‚Äì Lightweight seating for relaxing.
    • Tables ‚Äì Foldable options for cooking or games.
    • Hammocks ‚Äì Perfect for lazy afternoons.
    • Blankets ‚Äì Extra warmth around the fire.

    üõ†Ô∏è Practical Tips

    • Check campsite rules ‚Äì Fires, noise, and pets vary by site.
    • Pack for weather ‚Äì Rain gear and sun protection are equally important.
    • Leave no trace ‚Äì Take all rubbish and respect nature.
    • Test gear at home ‚Äì Avoid surprises on-site.

    üí¨ Common Mistakes (We‚Äôve Made Them Too)

    • Forgetting tent pegs or mallet
    • Packing too much heavy gear
    • Leaving food out overnight
    • Not checking forecast before setting up
    • Skipping campsite booking in peak season
